snippet: A review ordered by the new conservative government could lead to the first increase in military spending in a decade.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe orders his government to replace nation's five-year military spending plan and to review defense guidelines adopted in 2010; analysts say review is aimed at offsetting China's growing military power and may increase defense spending for first time in decade.
lead_paragraph: A review ordered by the new conservative government could lead to the first increase in military spending in a decade.

headline.seo: With Eye on China, Japan Weighs Raising Military Spending
headline.main: Japan Is Weighing Raising Military Spending
headline.print_headline: Japan Is Weighing Raising Military Spending
